bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: They are frequently changed; every day almost
bibl.orgName: The Walt Whitman Collection, Harry Ransom Humanities Research Center, The University of Texas at Austin
bibl.note: Transcribed from our own digital image of the original manuscript.

body.head: They are frequently changed
body.ab: and tents. They are frequently changed; every day almost there are removals and transferrings, (often without reason); sometimes the men are again taken back to the first place again —injured by being carried to and fro thus. ¶ It is almost impossible for a stranger to find any friend or relative sick in hospital here, these countless barracks. oneunless he has his the patients direction
